website_summaries.verdict: With a top-of-the-range construction and unique design, this competition approved knee sleeve has earned a special place in the hearts of many serious lifters.
pros: Ergonomic design is based on the actual contours of the leg for improved support and comfort
IFP and WIFP approval makes this an ideal option for professional lifters
Soft, flexible neoprene adds stability and warmth without compromising range of motion
High quality construction delivers long lasting durability
cons: Some feel the sizes run a bit large
Not as easy to find as others

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last nearly as long as I'd hoped
customer_reviews.text: I was quite happy with these for some time, but I'd say they're excessively priced for how long they've ended up lasting. I've had these about six months, using them for lifting 5 or 6 days a week. They are now noticeably looser than when I first got them, especially around the top, where they don't stay in place particularly well anymore or feel tight at all. Because of the loosening, they tend to easily bunch up around my knee joint when doing squats or just walking around, which is annoying. I think I'm going to try some SBD's, which are more expensive but may be better designed for durability.
customer_reviews.author: tqwert1

customer_reviews.title: Powerlifting? Buy 2 sizes down!
customer_reviews.text: WARNING: Powerlifters go 2 sizes down! 40 freaking dollars for one sleeve! I'm 5'11" 210lbs, bought 1 size down. The sizing chart would have me buy XL sleeves. I wish I had bought mediums. If you are lifting sub 315 lbs for your leg lifts these will work. If you are grinding some weight twice your weight or more buy 2 sizes down or just buy some inzer legwraps. Don't buy MAVA products period. Rehbands knee sleeves are quality, just buy the right sizes!
customer_reviews.author: Eddie Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: I had never used but I am sure glad I bought these! After a hard legwork out that includes squats, deadlifts, and cleans my knees feel great! They offer support and keep your knees nice and warm. I did not realize how big of a difference that can make. I am 5'10" 220lbs and went with a large even though I measure at an extra-large and they fit great. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Doonie Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Astonishing Knee Support, But Only Sells As Single Item
customer_reviews.text: I've used knee support for leg exercises and mostly dead lift or squat repetitions and felt support for the knees. But this brand is very good quality in the fact that it feels thicker and does not run up or down your leg during leg curl movements. Few can match the quality from this brand, it's expensive...very expensive. They sell these not as a pair, but individual braces...so if you want for both knees..which you should then it's actually double the price. It's a shocking amount to spend, but it's worth it and the only reason why the review is four instead of five stars.
customer_reviews.author: 로테군

customer_reviews.title: Don't fix it if it ain't broke
customer_reviews.text: Bought one sleeve a couple months ago for my knee that gets sore. Wanted another to prevent injury to other knee and you can tell there's been a design change. The one I just bought and returning is thinner and definitely more flexible. You can tell right away. The emblems are different and the materiel feels less firm then original.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Well-made, long lasting knee sleeves that provide terrific support for weightlifting
customer_reviews.text: Very solid construction, there's multiple fabric layers to the sleeve that creates a firm compression but remains pretty comfortable, and you can tell the materials used are high quality. Provides very comfortable compression during knee flexion (squats, lunges, deadlifts, etc.) and even gives a little bit of bounce "out of the hole". I would definitely recommend sizing down 1x if you're anywhere near in-between sizes - for instance, my knee measurement was 40cm and I chose a Large, which fits firmly but is not too small. In all honesty, the price point is just a little bit too high ($80 for a set of knee sleeves), but these are likely the highest quality sleeves you can get.
customer_reviews.author: Cory G.

customer_reviews.title: Great compression and helped with my knee pain
customer_reviews.text: I love Rehband! I have an older gray version of this knee sleeve that I still use and decided to buy a second one. This blue one is larger and just as good, if not better than my older gray sleeve. Love the compression and how I don't feel the pain in my knee when wearing it. Be sure to check the size, though. I believe the chart has you measure your calves. I have larger calves so it recommended a larger size then I should have used.
customer_reviews.author: Mark0

customer_reviews.title: Only One Sleeve, But Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: Note: This is only one sleeve! Haha, with its price point, I assumed it was two... I was wrong. Nowhere does it say it is two, Rehband is a great company and they did not try to trick me, I just didn't pay enough attention. I am a powerlifter and I ended up buying a second one. I use these primary during heavy leg day, specifically when squatting. They do a great job of keeping a lot of heat around the knee joint which is crucial when taking longer rests between heavier sets. They work great and I expect to use them for many years to come!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Brittan

customer_reviews.title: Great support & very durable
customer_reviews.text: Have tried other knee sleeves. This one is the best. Gives moderate amount of support for squats and deadlifts, between nothing and the elastic powerlifting knee wraps, unlike other sleeves I have tried that give warmth but no real support. Also useful for doing heavy outdoor work when you have osteoarthritic knees (like I do).
customer_reviews.author: Al C. (Hobbyist)

customer_reviews.title: I recently had a trainer recommend these sleeves to me
customer_reviews.text: I'm a powerlifter and have battled knee injuries. I recently had a trainer recommend these sleeves to me, as they are legal for raw division competitions. The sizing chart was very helpful, and the XXL fits me well. I don't feel resistance from the fabric when I deadlift or squat, and feel confident to keep adding more weight.
customer_reviews.author: AR

customer_reviews.title: good all.around knee sleeve for crossfit
customer_reviews.text: i've been using these knee sleeves for crossfit / weightlifting for a while now and feel they are a very good product... maybe a little pricey at forty.sumpthin' bucks per sleeve (_not_ pair) but worth it since they are durable unlike other knee sleeves that i've owned, which fell apart really quickly. i don't always wear knee sleeves. i'm kind'f a minimalist that way. however, whenever my knees start to act up, then i put them on... i kind'f get the feeling i should just wear them more often.
customer_reviews.author: beno hwang

customer_reviews.title: super comfy.
customer_reviews.text: I've been through a few knee sleeves in my lifting career. Most are uncomfortable and pinch behind the knee's, but not this one, super comfy...like your pillow after a long day. This is top quality I promise you. A suggestion for those who've never used knee sleeves: Try using some wraps to see if knee sleeves are the right move for you and your goals. If you decide you like it, test whether or not you like a snug fit or a tight fit. Lastly measure your knee, DO NOT GUESS MEASURE-MEASURE-MEASURE.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Best Sleeve for the Knee
customer_reviews.text: Best product I've found for knees and I have quite a few of them. My knees are shot, broke both of them on separate occasions during exercise/sports. If you're like me and fairly active, it can be extremely frustrating to have your training interrupted due to injuries. I use these all the time and wear them under my sweats, pants and sometimes just in my shorts. They look decent and wear well. I purchased two pairs of these but remember this sleeve is sold individually so you'll need to purchase two of them for a set.
customer_reviews.author: GlenD

customer_reviews.title: Good enough for squats
customer_reviews.text: After looking around and spending hours viewing other products, trying to get a "cheaper" deal. I came across these knee sleeves and decided to give them a chance. I WAS THAT GUY that bought ONE knee sleeve thinking it was both of them. Anyway, I went ahead a bought the second sleeve. I have used these sleeves on my last three leg days (Back Squats, Front Squats, Romanian and Sumo Deadlifts). They keep your knees VERY, VERY warm and provide good support. If you've ever trained in knee wraps, these will NOT give you that kind of support, however, I prefer knee sleeves over knee wraps. If you're in the market for knee sleeves I recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Carlitos_Wey

customer_reviews.title: Awesome support, warm knees
customer_reviews.text: I have squatted and deadlifted in these multiple times now and I am very happy with the purchase. I feel better, especially in the bottom of the movements, and my right knee experienced no pain at all when deadlifting like it used to. My knees stay noticeably warmer during my workouts (usually 5x5). I would 10/10 buy again should these wear out.
customer_reviews.author: HM

customer_reviews.title: I wish I'd bought these years ago
customer_reviews.text: I'm an aging powerlifter (57) and knee pain has been holding back my leg workouts for some years. These knee sleeves have had an immediate positive effect on my training. It no longer hurts to squat and I've been consistently increasing my weights now that I no longer have the constant threat of pain in the back of my mind. For those that are wondering, they don't support anything like knee wraps (even wrapped as lightly as you can wrap them and keep them up) but for me they've been great. EDIT: corrected some clumsy language
customer_reviews.author: S. Hedges

customer_reviews.title: What a difference these make
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing! Wore them for the first time tonight doing squats and leg press, no knee pain at all. I actually pushed more weight than usual. Half way through my leg routine is when my knees start to really ache but with these on I didn't feel a thing! I can't wait to try them out on the DL. These sleeves provide outstanding compression, support and heat generation... I'm really glad I decided to buy these over some cheaper brands I was looking at. I know the price seems a little steep, especially when you need to buy two, but once you realize what you're getting you'll understand why.
customer_reviews.author: RJG

customer_reviews.title: Very nicely constructed, comfortable, and do the job well.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these based on other reviews and followed the sizing that others recommended. I measure 41.5 cm around calf about 10 cm below patella. The Large fit nicely and are snug. The material is high quality and the durability seems top notch. I use them 1-2 times per week for squats. They keep the knee joint warm and give me the confidence I need to squat a little heavier than I would normally. My knees are bad from playing sports and I was worried to squat too heavy. These give me the confidence I need, plus my knees don't ache after squatting. I recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Kevalb

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic knee sleeves as expected
customer_reviews.text: These are the best sleeves out there for keeping your knees warm during squats. They are pricey but why bother paying less for something that barely functions when you can have a great set for $100. You should absolutely be buying a set. They will have a distinct odor after a while, just like your other equipment. They can be washed and should not be put in the dryer. As an aside, write your name on the sleeves in permanent marker. Had mine walk off while I had my back turned at the gym and it was more than a little upsetting. Been using this brand and these sleeves for a little over 3 years btw, 3 days a week.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Johns

customer_reviews.title: they look great, but they slide off very easily
customer_reviews.text: They are made to be durable, they look great, but they slide off very easily. Says if you have 17' knees, to get XXL so I did. Tight on my quads but I guess not tight enough. By end of workout they are down a few inches.
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: Not a pair?!
customer_reviews.text: This product comes as a single sleeve and not a pair. I suppose thats my own fault for not reading carefully enough, but I think a customer shouldn't have to read carefully for a product they are buying. In addition they offer no return policy on this item even though I still have it in it's original packaging. I am extremely dissapointed in this product and furthermore if anyone is about to spend $80 or more on a pai- two single knee sleeves* SBD is a much better knee sleeve for about the same price.
customer_reviews.author: Remy

customer_reviews.title: Saved My Knees
customer_reviews.text: I started having knee pain after years of doing intense leg workouts. I bought these in February of 2017 and they still are like new and I used them a couple times a week. Since using them, I have no more knee pain. I will not workout legs without them.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Always separates in a vertical strip along the front
customer_reviews.text: I thought these were the best, as I’ve always used this type for years. But I realize after only a little use, the inner padding separates along the front and creates a thin vertical strip, and only the outer layer is what holds it together. Happens after only a week or two. I’ve been buying new ones after lengthy use but after paying attention, this happens almost instantly.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Cease

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced - Don't Buy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair of these a few years ago for me. They work well enough. When my wife started squatting recently, I bought a pair for her as well. When the product arrived, only one sleeve was delivered. I went back to my order history and realized that they (same seller as before) are now selling ONE sleeve for the price they used to sell TWO! Total ripoff. They are good but not good enough to justify a 100% markup. That's what I get for clicking "Buy it Again" and believing I was buying the same thing as before. Next time, I will pay more attention.
customer_reviews.author: SoCal1998

customer_reviews.text: If you have any knee issues and you like to lift moderate/heavy, these are incredible. It feels like someone is holding your knees when you descend on squats or dead lifts. Makes for a very comfortable feeling. Only thing to watch out for is they get SMELLY if you don't wash them.
customer_reviews.author: Shane jones

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't be happier, worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: I tried a few cheaper knee sleeves and got what I paid for. They stretched out, tore and I had to constantly adjust them. I finally broke down and purchased the Rehband 7051 and so far I couldn't be happier. I've used them several times for deep heavy back squats. They stay in place well. They're comfortable and very warm. If they're good enough for guys like Big Z and other pro Strongman they're more than good enough for me. I'd definitely buy again. Worth every penny to my knees.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan M. Adkins

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Awesome support for my knee. I was in the military and of course my knees are bad. I was doing a WOD one day of over head kettle bell squats and in the down position my knee buckled and I instantly thought "Welp, surgery is in my future" However after nursing it for a few hours my coach gave me his Rehband 7mm to try and it was awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Van Sickmeier

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for Powerlifting - Warm, Cozy, Secure support for your knees
customer_reviews.text: I have gotten into powerlifting over the past few years, including heavy squatting and deadlifting. I never developed any serious knee pain, but figured it couldn't hurt. I love these knee sleeves so much. They make my knees feel warm, comfortable, have allowed me to get to 405 pound squats and 425 pound deadlifts, so far. I would recommend them to anybody, of any age, regardless of knee pain or not. I bought one for my dad for his torn meniscus, and he loves it. Do your knees and your lifting routine a favor and get these. Also contestants in the world's strongest man contest use them. So that's badass.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua E. Merry

customer_reviews.title: A friend recommended these. Yes
customer_reviews.text: My knees started to pop a lot when lifting. I don't have any pain, but wanted some extra support just in case. A friend recommended these. Yes, they are pricey, but they are of good quality. In addition to the compression, I like the insulation they provide to my knees during exercise.
customer_reviews.author: SM

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, poor sizing recommendations
customer_reviews.text: These knee sleeves are high quality but are not correctly sized. Be sure to order a size smaller if you want a snug but not competition fit. Two sizes smaller for a competition fit. Overall I still prefer STRONG sleeve's to these, but these are still great for keeping your knees warm and comfortable during squats.
customer_reviews.author: Monty

customer_reviews.title: My knees feel better when I use them than when I don't
customer_reviews.text: These knee sleeves provide a level of compression that give some therapeutic treatment. I use them for high intensity interval training and weight lifting. My knees feel better when I use them than when I don't. My only issue with these sleeves is that they tend to slide down and bunch up at the top of my knees during use.
customer_reviews.author: Neph

customer_reviews.title: Awesome knee support for lower body lifting!
customer_reviews.text: I had to repurchase this because my first was stolen and it's that good. I've had issues in the past with my right knee and this provides great comfort while squatting, deadlifting, snatching, and cleaning. I wasn't believing the hype at first (lots of people have it at the gym), but I decided to give it a go and I feel weird without it now (while lifting). No, it's not going to add 10 pounds to any of your lifts, but the support and warmth is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: KAREEM

customer_reviews.title: I turn it inside out after the workout because it gets sweaty.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first knee brace to be used while doing squats. It helped right away. I have pain in the top of my knee cap area and when wearing this I can max squat. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Roger S. Stark

customer_reviews.title: Awesome investment for my knees
customer_reviews.text: I selected one size smaller than the size chart and it fits perfectly in terms of not being too tight for me to wear for 3 hours and still give plenty of support. I do squats twice a week and deadlifts once a week and the Rehbands have been the single most important investment I made for the health of my knees. The Rehbands provide plenty of support and they keep my knees nice and warm. I have a family history of knee problems so with the Rehbands and proper form, my knees feel better than ever.
customer_reviews.author: Jo Momma

customer_reviews.title: which is fine for olympic lifting and even general strength athletes
customer_reviews.text: Adds some compression to your knees and keeps them warm, which is fine for olympic lifting and even general strength athletes. But if you're a serious powerlifter looking to get some real compression and more leg coverage, you're better off with Evolutionize knee sleeves, STrong sleeves or SBD sleeves.
customer_reviews.author: Marc Flores

customer_reviews.title: Has prevented aches and improved my squat numbers
customer_reviews.text: Bought one sleeve for a knee that suffered an injury ten years ago, with the aim of alleviating some stress on it while squatting. Measured 41 cm around middle of knee cap while standing. Ordered size Large. Not quite snug enough. Replaced with a size Medium. Was super happy with its fit at this size. Felt so good squatting with it that a bought another one for the knee that's fine. With this and a weight belt for the first time, my squats went up 50 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Chris O.

customer_reviews.title: they are great! I dont think they help you lift more
customer_reviews.text: Get the 7mm, they are great! I dont think they help you lift more, but they certainly make a nice difference! I wear them for every workout! A nice benefit for cross fit is that they are nice when it comes to burpies, and lunges or anywhere where your knees hit the ground!
customer_reviews.author: Albertson

customer_reviews.title: These sleeves are awesome.
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome sleeves. Had my first pair for 4 years and they are still just fine. Bought another pair for use in competition. They are mildly supportive and extremely comfortable. Very easy to put on and take off. Took my squat from 315 to 550 in these, and I'm not even tempted to try another brand. I'd recommend these to anyone at any level.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Carstensen

customer_reviews.title: Best knee Sleeve I've purchased yet
customer_reviews.text: Best knee Sleeve I've purchased yet. My knees hurt from squatting and other exercises. I've purchased a few other knee sleeves and was happy with the results. But the Rehband are definitely the best for sure. They have a snuggerr fit and the material is softer and more flexible than it's competitors. They are a little more costly but worth every penny
customer_reviews.author: AJB

customer_reviews.title: Knee pain shouldn't hold you back
customer_reviews.text: I have a torn meniscus, arthritis and swelling in my right knee. Everything hurts. I put my knee sleave on before my workout and within minutes my knee warms up and is secure. I feel no pain! I do Crossfit, boxing and running and I do it all with my Rehband on. It not only keeps my knee secure and straight but it also keeps it warm and flexible. I don't feel any restraint or limitation. My knee sweats right through the band. This is the best product!
customer_reviews.author: Shiroosh

customer_reviews.title: Might seem expensive but 100% worth it!!!
customer_reviews.text: These help tremendously with knee-pain while weight-training (squat). Size down one. Mostly for keeping knee warm and lubed, confidence, some stability help. I've used these thru about 200 workouts (squat/deadlift mostly) and still look almost new, worth the money. Will smell bad eventually, just throw in gentle wash once a month after a short vinegar soak. Air dry.
customer_reviews.author: Scherzo

customer_reviews.title: High-quality and great fit
customer_reviews.text: Excellent knee sleeves for lifting in. Keep in mind that knee sleeves are not meant to help you lift more weight (get knee wraps for that) these are intended to give you some compression and to heat up the knee, helping prevent strain and injury. My knees felt great during a heavy backsqat then heavy clean session.
customer_reviews.author: Parnell A. Springmeyer

customer_reviews.title: Bad Knees
customer_reviews.text: I am an avid weight lifter and have bad knees. I've had surgery on both knees where they go in with a scope and clean out cartridge. Since that point, anything I do (Squats, Leg Extensions) puts a lot of pain on my knees. Using these wraps have provided comfort and warmth to the joints, allowing me to work out pain free. I also use topical DMSO cream and put the wraps over the cream which helps the cream stay on. I recommend this to anyone with knee pain!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel S.

customer_reviews.title: GREAT ITEM BUT ITS ONLY ONE ORDER TWO
customer_reviews.text: Have been using these for over 4 months so far and I'm very happy with the quality of them, I did make a mistake and only bought one which is upset me but that's my problem not the company a lack of reading at the time. I use these when I squat, I follow a power lifting style of training as its what I do. I ordered these as I was squatting 3 times a week to get my 1rm up and wanted to make sure I had some protection with a the high volume I was doing. Knees did fine and rarely felt sore after the session (other than normal muscle soreness)
customer_reviews.author: Juan Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: As a powerlifting enthusiast, these were a godsend. I was having a bad case of Patellofemoral pain syndrome (PFPS) and these helped to stabilize my knees and keep them warm during squats and leg presses. I believe I’ve been able to squat deeper with these, and I no longer have any pain in my knees for the most part.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Great sleeve!
customer_reviews.text: Great sleeve!! You will feel the difference on your knees, pain when lifting more weight is gone as you use them more often. At the beginning feel awkward as it heat up more than usual, but then get use to it and you'll love them.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love the rehbands
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love the rehbands! If you're looking for a knee sleeve that will add weight to your squat, these aren't it. However, these definitely keep your knees warm. Living in a cold environment, keeping your knees warm is a must. When your knees are warm, they feel more stable. This product will not help fix your knees caving. I get that question a lot. Go back to technique.
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Sleeve
customer_reviews.text: Keeps my knees warm and the last a long time. Really love the quality and the stability that these provide during my lifts.
customer_reviews.author: GP Bookmark Kid

customer_reviews.title: Used for over a year. Still like new
customer_reviews.text: These have not lost any of their firmness or compression after almost a years use. Also used in a powerlifting competition. Ill be buying these again when the time comes for a new pair.
customer_reviews.author: Jnmugno

customer_reviews.title: Best of the best...without the need for metal supports-
customer_reviews.text: Amazing how much support this brace offers. After only six weeks of recovery from ACL surgery, this brace has accelerated healing in the joint. Whether that is from increased blood flow from the warmth of the brace, I don't know. But after using twenty or so knee braces over the years and two ACL surgeries, this brace can't be beat.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin David

customer_reviews.title: High price, but high quality
customer_reviews.text: Important note that I didn’t notice at first but these are ONE PER PURCHASE. They DO NOT come as a pair. That aside, these are some of the best knee sleeves I’ve owned. They are more expensive than others but I can honestly say you really get what you pay for. High quality materials and very snug/supportive that do not bind or pinch. Not sure if these will ever wear out but if they did I wouldn’t hesitate to get another pair.
customer_reviews.author: Nigel

customer_reviews.title: Fits a little big
customer_reviews.text: My knee measures a little over 16.5 inches around so I bought a XL as per the fit chart. It was too loose so I will be returning it. Also this is not for 2 sleeves, you are only purchasing one. It looks like a well made product.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Amazing quality and feel
customer_reviews.text: Keeps knees warm as well as supported. These fit perfect per the size guide. Glad I went with Rehband. Great color and materials.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best knees braces I’ve used .
customer_reviews.text: These seem to work better for me,I ordered 5mm by mistake and realized that the 7mm were the ones I ordered before.
customer_reviews.author: Melvin Foster

customer_reviews.title: Saved my knees!
customer_reviews.text: These saved squats for me. Prior to wearing these on both knees, whenever I'd do squats, my knees would be weak for days. Not necessarily painful, but even the act of squatting down to pick something off the floor would result in my knees buckling. Since I started using these on my working sets, my knees hold up much better in the days after a workout. Note that I don't use these for my warmup sets - only my working sets. I do not have a history of knee problems and I'd like to keep it that way, and these things do it!
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Reichelt

customer_reviews.title: Wearing this brace helped my knees when doing the squat ...
customer_reviews.text: Wearing this brace helped my knees when doing the squat. I recently lifted 315# and I'm only 158! Hardly any complaints from knees. I had a ski accident a few years ago and me and my knees swear by this product. Just be sure to measure correctly. As long as you do the fit guide should get you the right pair. It does get hot and my knees sweat a lot while wearing it, but the comfort and support it provides is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: WT

customer_reviews.title: Yes, order one size down.
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Smells like the inside of a wakeboard boot. Go from cold, clicking knees to hot knees. My knee measures 36cm and I ordered two Small ones. They fit great and are not too tight. They are definitely tightest above the knee, so if you have HUGE thighs you might want to stick with the normal size. You are probably skeptical because of the price. I know I was. Don't just get them because you think they might make you PR on a squat. Get them if you actually have knee issues and they will be worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Product
customer_reviews.text: I had surgery for a torn meniscus, and was looking for a knee sleeve to wear during CrossFit training. I love this knee sleeve. It fits well and offers just enough support. It provides just the right amount of stability that I needed post surgery. I wear this for all squatting movements, running, jumnping, and lunging. I have had it for several months, and it appears to be very durable. I recommend this knee sleeve for anyone that is looking for a little extra support and stability for their knee.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Only wore them once so far and love them. Been using TK's for the last few ...
customer_reviews.text: Only wore them once so far and love them. Been using TK's for the last few months, the Rehband are on a different level of quality and fit. Definitely worth the money, and since USAPL doesn't allow TK's anymore, I didn't have much choice. I measured 36cm per the instructions, went with the size medium hoping to get a slightly tighter fit, and they fit a little tight (just how I want them). I probably could have got away with the size small if I really wanted to get some pop out of them, but I expect to "grow into these".
customer_reviews.author: P. Clough

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I started getting into powerlifting for fun and started noticing some mild knee discomfort. Ended up investing in a pair of rehbands and am glad I did. They fit quite snug and help warm up your joints before you start squatting. Since then, the discomfort has gone away (comes back if I lift without them though). So for that, I'll continue to use them. Great and durable knee sleeves!
customer_reviews.author: TVO

customer_reviews.title: I can squat again!
customer_reviews.text: My right knee sort of shifts halfway point on ATG squat and my trusty knee wrap wasn't quite cutting it. This sleeve does warm up your knee well and give very good support for keeping your knee in line. I was able to perform squat again while nursing the knee.
customer_reviews.author: Makoto S.

customer_reviews.title: Supportive AND Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I am now recovering from my second knee surgery and needing some more support. I have tried a number of different knee support devices including the ones with the hard bars (pre-surgery) ones with holes in the patella. They all cling, bind, hurt, and are generally unbearable uncomfortable at some point during this day. I can wear this all day long. It makes my knee feel better but allows me freedom of movement, and generally I can get through the day with it on. It seems to wash and dry well overnight, but I just ordered a second one so I can alternate.
customer_reviews.author: BethGB

customer_reviews.title: Best knee sleeve and I've tried quite a few.
customer_reviews.text: I've bought a few of these because of weakening knees from sports and life now that I'm in my 40s and this one is the best. I used it when I recently sprained some ligaments in my knee (cleaning my car) and it improved greatly in a few weeks. I still use it when it's feeling a bit weak and when I play golf and holds your knee snug but not feeling restrictive or tight. The ace bandage and other types sold at grocery stores are garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan McKinley

customer_reviews.title: Fits well, But
customer_reviews.text: I have relatively large calves, but with a little effort I can get this on. It fits beautifully. One major complaint. This is NOT hypo allergenic and I broke out with a severe rash after only an hour of use. I wish I could wear it but the rash behind the knee and on the sides is severe. Note: I was using this to help control swelling from a full knee replacement when I would ride my road bike.
customer_reviews.author: Michael B

customer_reviews.title: ... for about a year and they are still in perfect shape. I used to have knee annoyances such ...
customer_reviews.text: I've used these for about a year and they are still in perfect shape. I used to have knee annoyances such as popping and some pressure build up. I no longer have those issues. I use these through my whole leg workout. They give enough pressure without becoming a discomfort throughout a long period of use. Because of these I gave up knee straps.
customer_reviews.author: Anita Fleischer

customer_reviews.title: Good support, solid product
customer_reviews.text: Good product- helps me work out and feel more secure after my patellar tendon rupture. Get a size small as others suggest- it was tight for a bit but wore in nicely. It gets a bit smelly after wearing and sweating in at a lot which is to be expected. I simply shower with it on and get it soapy to clean it- it’s fine then.
customer_reviews.author: tvic

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality and feel so far
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality and feel so far, I will post a review after a few months of use, but wanted to comment on sizing for those who are trying to decide. I measure 39cm mid knee and ordered a Large and it fit perfectly. I can't imagine sizing smaller and I don't imagine they will stretch much, but ill be sure to update if they do. So yeah, order your size!
customer_reviews.author: H.F

customer_reviews.title: Snug, not tight
customer_reviews.text: Perfect thickness and size. I used their sizing chart, took measurements and couldn't be happier. A lot of people suggested choosing a size smaller, but I don't think I'd be able to pull them on if they were any tighter. The "right" size is snug, very, but not tight.
customer_reviews.author: David M

customer_reviews.title: Knee sleeve
customer_reviews.text: I need a knee replacement but am too young for it according to the doctor. I am still active and these are effective as a support for treadmill, marathons (walking) and lifting. An ED MD recommended them at work. She does crossfit and loves them. I was impressed as I am hard to fit as am a plus size woman and knee wraps/braces tend to roll or slide down. These didn't budge during the road race I wore them for. I would highly recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Cleveland

customer_reviews.title: Great Knee Sleeves, Runs Big
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these for a couple of years now and they're still holding up. They smell terrible after about a week of wearing but I throw them in a delicates bag with a couple of t shirts to weigh them down and wash them with my gym clothes. I recommend the smalls. I am 175lb male and the mediums were too big.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Ford

customer_reviews.title: without using these to keep my knees nice and tight
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd pair of Rehbands and the first pair actually lasted me 4 years! I wouldn't even consider doing a heavy Crossfit workout, cleans, deadlifts etc.... without using these to keep my knees nice and tight! Once you go Rehband and you forget to take them with you to the gym you realize how much you rely on them to get you through a work out. I wouldn't use any other brand! Hopefully you can still find these cause their getting harder and harder to find.
customer_reviews.author: Art Harrington

customer_reviews.title: The BEST of the BEST
customer_reviews.text: I LOVEEEE these knee sleeves! The BEST of the BEST! And for such a great price! My knees never hurt after squatting heavy anymore or after long training sessions. (I compete in strongman so I use these A LOT). Super durable and live up to the expectations. They do get stinky after a while though so I just pop them in the washer and let them air dry. The size small fit me perfect...I'm 5'7, 165lbs, female. (If that helps anybody). I'm going to try out the Rehband elbow sleeves next. This brand really delivers quality!
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Prepare for New PRs!
customer_reviews.text: This took my squat game to the next level. Having knee issues yet always striving to go beyond parallel and proper oly lift squat.. this is what I was missing. Not only are knees more stable, shins don't suffer on deads from bar scrapage.. this is literally the reason leg day went from least to second favorite workout day of the week. Yes, they are a bit pricey for being individual but you do get what you pay for. I've had mine for almost a year now and they're still holding up flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: xDoWnFaLLL

customer_reviews.title: Best Knee support ever!
customer_reviews.text: I have bought several knee pads and support braces throughtout my life and this is top knotch. I even got a pair for my friend who can barely run or jump or do anything high impact because his knee hurts. My bf uses it too and he tore his miniscus and he feels no pain when he squats, snatches, cleans, jumps ropes or anything! its like having temporary new knees but you still have to stregthen your knees when your not using this or your just masking the pain and eventually you will get worst.
customer_reviews.author: Brooklyn Nerd

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Great purchase! I use all the time with squats and DL.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GREAT for Crossfit!
customer_reviews.text: Got these for Crossfit workouts. AS you know if you do Crossfit the workouts can be BRUTAL on the knees. I love these for keeping my knees in place ;) and also for workouts with a lot of Lunges, Burpees, or any other workout where you have shorts on and your knees will be contacting the floor a lot. Great protection. Also these are thicker and seem to be more durable and well made than the new style gray ones. Just my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: ActvOutdoors

customer_reviews.title: The added support is very nice and they give you a nice spring in coming ...
customer_reviews.text: Got these after having some significant knee pains that kept me from doing leg days for weeks. The added support is very nice and they give you a nice spring in coming out of the hole on squats. Definitely recommend if you're planning to lift heavier or looking to protect your knees.
customer_reviews.author: Beau Lewis

customer_reviews.title: All the difference in the world
customer_reviews.text: I joined a cross fit box 8 months ago - incorporating so many different exercises, lifts, etc into a workout has had many positive effects on my health - my cross fit coach recommended the rehband knee sleeves because of pain I was having in both knees - the pain is related to old meniscal tears in both knees - purchasing the knee sleeves has allowed me to continue working out with absolutely no pain - it made the difference between continuing to work out and having to take some time-off! I would highly recommend this product to anyone with knee pain or old knee injuries!
customer_reviews.author: J from SA

customer_reviews.title: They are cool. Not a necessity.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for the heck of it. I had some extra money so I bought these very expensive one warmers. I would imagine that along with keeping your knee warm you will decrease your risk of ligament and tendon injuries. Specifically the MCL, LCL and maybe your meniscus. These are not performance increasing wraps. They do not provide support for heavy lifts. They are merely to keep your knees warm to prevent injury. I plan on buying the elbow sleeves as well
customer_reviews.author: N33N0

customer_reviews.title: Best knee bands for athletes
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my boyfriend as a gift .. Didnt really like the price they are very pricey but he had heard good things and really really wanted these.. Today I said hey how do you like your rehbands and he turned around with a big smile and said "I LOVE them"! He has really bad knees and still squats really heavy while wearing these .. I tried them on and the seemed to mold to my knee, very snug .. He gives them an A+
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: They were especially comfortable when power-walking during the cold winter months
customer_reviews.text: These sleeves fit well and offer additional support that my ailing knees need. They were especially comfortable when power-walking during the cold winter months. However, they do not breath so you will feel the heat a little bit during the warmer months. The quality is excellent and I even like the blue color.
customer_reviews.author: Jack D. Underwood

customer_reviews.title: Knee approved :P
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband who has some knee problems, and he appreciates it very much. He was looking to buy a pair of his own and was saving $ but I decided to buy it for him as a Christmas gift and he loves them! He says they are very comfortable and help alleviates his knee problem especially when he lifts heavy weights.
customer_reviews.author: Dee Vee 81

customer_reviews.title: I have recommended this to several people
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding product. I would not squat without these. It helps my knees to not take as much. I have recommended this to several people. I would say order one size small then what you measure for. I measured for a large and ordered a medium and it works perfectly not super tight just right. Shipping was right on schedule. I would recommend seller to anyone
customer_reviews.author: Freedom

customer_reviews.title: Older version > Newer Version
customer_reviews.text: Thicker neoprene than the newer versions, many people are going back to this version. Fits great, keeps your knees warm, and feel great during your lifts. I took my knee measurements as noted on the site and they fit perfectly. I didn't think I was a large, but I am! They are snug. But, buy two. Don't just wear one... Also, wash them. Often. Don't stink. If your knee smells after your workout, you waited too long.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Gonzales

customer_reviews.title: Happy Knees!
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had known about these long ago. They offer excellent compression and flexibility, while also offering a bit of a "spring" back up from a deep squat. The support offered by these 7mm knee sleeves has alleviated any/all discomfort I was experiencing when squatting & deadlifting heavy. They are solid for lifting but don't inhibit movement if you are mixing in sprints or metcon-type (crossfit) workouts. I would buy them again and do recommend them to my friends.
customer_reviews.author: DrStTee

customer_reviews.title: These feel good while wearing them
customer_reviews.text: These feel good while wearing them, but they're constantly slipping down and needing to be pulled back up into place. This is my first time using sleeves so maybe that's normal, but to me that makes them more annoying than it does helpful so I end up not using them.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain

customer_reviews.title: i am squatting 435lbs and I am confident that these sleeves will help me continue on with my favorite hobby. i also use these wh
customer_reviews.text: I started using these sleeves once I started squatting 315lbs+. I've had knee issues in the past and i've even had surgery in my right knee. This caused my left knee to overcompensate and I started having issues in my left. When i use these sleeves, it really allows me to squat without worrying about my knee pain and focusing on my lifts. Currently, i am squatting 435lbs and I am confident that these sleeves will help me continue on with my favorite hobby. i also use these when i deadlift. very durable, fairly priced, and does exactly what it should do. great buy in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: sang yi

customer_reviews.title: Love my Rehbands!
customer_reviews.text: These are great. I bought the size small - I am a 5'4" 150 lb woman. They have really helped me up my squat weight and make me feel more stable when squatting. I feel no knee discomfort at all, keeps them warmed up. I pull them down over my shins when I deadlift to avoid scraping from the bar, they are a little big for that, but they don't move around. It's better than wearing long pants in the summer time and I don't like the high socks.
customer_reviews.author: Mom2agr8boy

customer_reviews.title: These are probably the 2nd best knee sleeves on the market (after SBDs)
customer_reviews.text: These are probably the 2nd best knee sleeves on the market (after SBDs). These fit a little bit looser than the SBDs and I think I actually prefer these for weightlifting (snatch/clean and jerk) but the SBDs for powerlifting (squat). Either is a great choice. I've had my rehbands for a couple of years and they are still in great shape but I will probably pick up the SBDs just cause skwatz.
customer_reviews.author: Kristie Almeida

customer_reviews.title: Buy different model
customer_reviews.text: Stitching doesn't feel good on skin, different model feels better
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra

customer_reviews.title: measure your knee prior to ordering
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure these are great knee sleeves but I purchased the wrong size and had to return them. Be sure to measure you knee prior to purchasing knee wraps, don't just assume that because you wear a large in clothing you should get a large in knee wraps. That said, the wrap was fantastic quality, strong, durable, flexible and machine washable. I ordered a larger size Rehband (which I also reviewed) and they are perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Johnathan

customer_reviews.title: Great knee sleeve honestly now that I'm going deeply on ...
customer_reviews.text: Great knee sleeve honestly now that I'm going deeply on my bodybuilding training they have help so much!!! Keeping your knees warm and tight throughout the entire leg day especially if your squatting or focusing on your quads they're a major key!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mauricio Lomeli

customer_reviews.title: I used to get terrible knee pain when walking after squatting
customer_reviews.text: Makes a world of difference when I squat the day after. I used to get terrible knee pain when walking after squatting. These have eliminated that pain and helped heal some bursitis I had in my knees. I use them daily. I ordered a slightly smaller size then what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Great sleeves
customer_reviews.text: I have a 14.5" knee. I ordered one medium and one large. Both fit ok, but the medium was just a little better - a little snugger and less slack overall. I ordered a second medium for weightlifting. I still use the large for running. I had a pair of Tommy Kono's in medium. They ripped after about 6 months and I replaced them with these. I will buy Rehbands in the future, over the TKs.
customer_reviews.author: Sean M

customer_reviews.title: The gold (blue) standard.
customer_reviews.text: These are still THE best knee sleeves you can buy for weight training of any kind. Thick, comfortable, with just enough compression to add warmth and support without being restrictive. Construction is solid and if you take care of them these should last you for years. Yes, they are pricey, but think of it as an investment. Your knees will thank you.
customer_reviews.author: M. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great Knee Support
customer_reviews.text: My husband has arthritis in his knees. He loves crossfit but his knees were killing him. These provide great knee support for lifting and squats. They stay in place and fit true to size. He's been using them approximately 4 days a week, for a few months now. They haven't stretched out or become worn out. Made of quality material and very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Best for lifting
customer_reviews.text: Perfeect for lifting i bought m few years ago now i had to buy large because i could stretch it any more...greatest quality....make sure give the right meassure
customer_reviews.author: walter paz

customer_reviews.title: Went one size down to the XL my measurement was ...
customer_reviews.text: Went one size down to the XL my measurement was 48 but it wasn’t as tight as I wanted. I’m a college athlete and I do a lot of Olympic lifts but the quality is superb I return them and got a full refund from amazon I’m gonna get them in LARGE I can’t wait to use them definitely worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: CrossFit must have!
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking at this item, you probably know what they are for without much explanation. I'm a relatively new CrossFit junkie, so I got these upon the recommendation of fellow athletes. I don't do any WODs that involve a lot of knee-bending without them. I suggest getting 1 size smaller than what the chart says you should get.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas A Goodman

customer_reviews.title: awesome knee sleeves
customer_reviews.text: i bought these for a little extra support with my squats as i'm doing smolov to up my squat max. i never had any knee issues without sleeves but man these make your knees feel so nice. they are really comfortable, keep your knee warm and the support they give is awesome. plus you look pretty sweet rocking these in the gym. i am very glad i invested in a pair, definitely recommended!!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan C. Morris

product_meta.title: Rehband 7mm Knee Sleeve - Model 7051 Original Blue
product_meta.description: Rehband RX Original V Knee Sleeve 7mmThe 7051 is the Original Rehband 7mm knee sleeve, made popular by top weightlifters and fitness athletes around the world.This knee support provides the knee joint strong compression, powerful stabilization, and warmth. Quality testing has proved the 7051 relieves pressure and improves coordination. Benefits include prevention of knee problems such as strains, overuse injuries, and swelling. The Rx Original V Knee Sleeve’s three panel design has been loved and used by weightlifters for generations.Powerful support is heightened in this 7mm thick sleeve by 100% Neoprene development and Pique top layer, a very strong and durable material. The support’s design targets muscle energy around the knee area for controlled power and acceleration; followed by support for the body returning to an upright position. The 7051 Rx Original V Knee Sleeve is ideal for static heavy lifting and is considered to be one of Rehband’s most supportive products.Benefits Include:Used and loved by weightlifters for decadesIncreased muscle control to reduce energy wasteSuperior joint stability and safetyFast warm-up and heat retentionRelief of knee pain and swellingAdvanced material technology for enhanced durabilityIPF & IWF Legal for Raw and Open CompetitionFits right or left knee
feature_bullets: Feel more confident and secure in any activity, from weekend warrior pursuits to powerlifting or elite competitive sports. The Rehband 7051 7mm model provides knee support with comfortable, flexible, knee joint compression. Rehband's 7mm neoprene knee compression sleeve acts as a mobile knee support that offers warmth, relieves pressure, and improves coordination for any activity.

The Rehband knee support pattern construction is built on an anatomical fit so unique that it has been patented! Due to this product’s medical classifications, they are sold as a single unit. Note a package will contain a single knee sleeve.

The Rehband knee sleeve provides reinforcement all the way around the knee, and allows for a safe, optimal range of motion in any leg-driven activity - whether you’re an elite athlete or just casually active, and no matter how old you are. It’s perfect to help prevent strain or injury, while also ideal to use for faster recovery and rehabilitation from knee strains or other wear and tear.

Rehband has been a top-flight, dependable creator of knee supports and other joint support technology for decades, making only the highest quality handcrafted products since 1955. Designed in Sweden and produced in Europe, we build our products in close collaboration with athletes.  We keep one foot in medical science and one foot on the sports field  to address every point of potential need for our customers.

If you’re like Rehband, you want to make the best possible choices in your life, and for your health. Choose Rehband and find out why so many of the world’s most elite athletes select our knee sleeves over any others. Opt for the uncompromising, premium quality and superior design of Rehband knee support to stay healthy, get stronger, and reach your full potential.
